CARDINAL . In GPE , hunting rights over land belong in principle to the landowner . However , Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , known as the “ PERSON ” , provides for the pooling of hunting grounds within ACCAs . The creation of an ORG in each municipality is compulsory in CARDINAL of the ninetythree départements of metropolitan GPE excluding ORG , ORG and GPE , including in ORG ; in the remainder of those CARDINAL départements it is optional . Landowners whose property forms part of the hunting grounds of an ORG in this way automatically become members of the association . They lose their exclusive hunting rights over their own land but have the right to hunt throughout the area covered by the ORG .

However , the owners of land with a surface area above a certain threshold may object to the inclusion of their land in the ORG ’s hunting grounds or request its removal from them ( in the département of ORG , the threshold is QUANTITY , which corresponds to the statutory minimum area ) . Since the entry into force of Law no . DATE of DATE , landowners “ who , being opposed to hunting as a matter of personal conviction , prohibit hunting , including by themselves , on their property ” also have this option , irrespective of the surface area of their land ( see paragraphs QUANTITY below ) .

The system of approved hunters’ associations was devised on general - interest grounds to prevent the unregulated exercise of hunting and promote rational use of game stocks . CARDINAL ] taken in conjunction with LAW of [ LAW . It follows from the above that ORG incorrectly based its ruling on a breach of [ these provisions ] in setting aside the impugned decisions ... ”

CARDINAL . In principle , hunting rights over land belong to the landowner . Article PERSON of LAW states that “ [ n]o one shall have the right to hunt on land belonging to another without the consent of the owner or any person entitled through or under the owner ” .

However , the legislature deemed it necessary for hunting grounds to be “ pooled ” in some cases . This was the purpose of Law no . CARDINAL of DATE , known as the “ FAC , which is applicable in the départements of metropolitan GPE other than ORG , ORG and GPE and provides for the establishment of approved municipal and intermunicipality hunters’ associations ( “ ACCAs ” and “ AICAs ” ) .

CARDINAL . The ACCAs pool hunting grounds at municipal level . Under LAW of LAW , in the version applicable at the material time , they are “ designed to ensure sound technical organisation of hunting . They shall encourage , on their hunting grounds , an increase in game stocks and wildlife while preserving a genuine balance between agriculture , forestry and hunting , provide instruction to their members in hunting - related matters and ensure the control of vermin and compliance with hunting plans ... Their role is also to ensure that hunters contribute to the conservation of natural habitats and wild flora and fauna ” .

The ACCAs are subject to the ordinary law on associations ( LAW ) and to the specific provisions of FAC and the regulatory instruments implementing it ( Articles PERSON seq . and Articles R. CARDINAL - CARDINAL et seq . of LAW ) . The prefect issues approval after checking that the requisite formalities have been completed and that the association ’s constitution and internal rules conform to the statutory requirements ( Articles L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL and PERSON of LAW ) . The prefects are responsible for supervising the ACCAs , and any change to their constitutions , internal rules or hunting regulations must be submitted to the prefect for approval ( Articles R. DATE and PERSON of LAW ) . In the event of a breach by the ORG of its constitution or hunting regulations or of damage to property , crops or public freedoms , or of a general breach of the relevant regulatory provisions ( Articles PERSON seq . of LAW ) , the prefect may also adopt interim measures such as the suspension of hunting on all or part of the association ’s hunting grounds or the dissolution of its executive committee ( LAW of LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Landowners whose land is included in an ORG ’s hunting grounds are automatically members of the association ( Article PERSON of LAW ) . They lose their exclusive hunting rights over the land but , as members , have the right to hunt throughout the association ’s hunting grounds in accordance with its regulations ( Articles PERSON and L. DATE of LAW ) .

The transfer of hunting rights entitles the landowner to compensation , payable by the ORG , for any loss of profits caused by being deprived of a previous source of income . The ORG is also obliged to pay compensation to owners of hunting rights who have “ made improvements to the land over which they have hunting rights ” ( Article PERSON of LAW ) .
